column2: Bring out some bait and wait
Camp by an affected village with your horses
column3: Reste a la rendez-vous avec vos chevales.

column2: Let's observe the folk saying "Talk of tigers and they are sure to come".

You feel bad throwing away a whole lamb, but are sure the tiger will feel worse. You wait playing two rounds of Yunnori with Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] until you hear intense bleating from behind the thicket. The beast has returned. Rushing to your saddle and with the dogs disappearing you make a decision.
Try to lure the cat into the clear.
Charge!
Ride around the tiger.

Part of the company rides to the edge of the forest. You wait on your trained dogs to wear down the prey. Soon enough through the fog the Great White Hope appears on the edge of the new terrain. You ready your spears and safe in numbers surround the tiger. As you draw near, you see the tiger bristling with wrath as you spear it to death from all sides..
I dub you polecat.
Your company rides out to the forest edge. After a few minutes you hear confused yelps in the woods. It transpires the hunt is finished, the tiger is not anywhere near and two dogs need good help.
Mongrols!.

The trapped tiger looks a blurred black, white and red mess as the lance approaches. The point goes clean by her neck and is buried in the ground behind the body. You take the game back to the homestead.
Phew! Did it look as good as it felt?

Your horse bursts through the bushes. You trample a huntsdog by mistake, slowing down you notice your dogs scattering left and right. No amount of whistling brings the dogs closer as you suddenly see the tigeress has made a stop and has two cubs. You charge into the tiger but miss. The tiger jumps on you and your men quickly surround you.
His Magesty is dying out here!

Your horse bursts through the bushes and trips over a large exposed root. You hear a snap and are flung into half eaten lamb. While you curse the loss your men stream past you in pursuit of the Tiger.
Drats!.

You set after the tiger at a furious pace. The tiger doesn't let but your party are enjoying the chase. After a hearty chase you circle around the animal in ever smaller circles toying with it. The big cat goes mad with indecision and utterly exhausted is bled to death by periodic sword swipes. You feel that it died inside before leaving its mortal coil.
The fur is mine.

You set after the tiger at a furious pace. The tiger doesn't let but your party are enjoying the chase. After a hearty chase you circle around the animal in ever smaller circles toying with it. The big cat goes mad with indecision and utterly exhausted is bled to death by periodic sword swipes. You feel that it died inside before leaving its mortal coil. Also two tiger cubs are found.
Besides my fur these will make nice gifts for a certain someone.
Spare the spares.
You camp outside a village after reassuring the village elder. The villagers are throwing a fete for a newly married couple, you and your men are keeping vigilence from a distance.
It would be shameful to give up
What a shame all these tender women.
This task is bogus.
Dig a tiger trap.
One by one the lanterns and laughs go out in the village. A coldness engulfs you and your men.
Let's go home before we get sick
Send some men to the village wall.
Set up the campfire and tents. The tiger isn't coming today.
You and a select few of your men go into the village and see a public dance is in procession. You assess the situation.
Pick the most fair maiden to dance with.
Drink soju then join in the dance.
Accuse the elder of being the tiger
Head back to your men.

Your men head to the village wall. Suddenly you hear a call. You run over to see the fearful figure hunched over the village walls. It is the tiger with a goat dripping from its mouth. The hunt has begun!
After it!
Archers Fire!
Give me your bow.

Your men head to the village wall. Suddenly you hear a savage cry and a scream. You run over to see a tiger trying to drag a teeming soldier into the night. The remaining soldiers look stricken with fear at such demon.
Charge!
Archers Fire!
Let's get out of here!.

You creep out your tent and you see the tiger next to the fire. It is trying to hook the roast piglet off the stake. You grab a standard from the earth. The Tiger continues to tear at the roast pork, trying to knock it off. It knocks off the grease pot and the brown taste spills on the tiger.
Stab the tiger into the fire.
Realistically this won't work.
You are snuggled in your tent, warmed by your dogs, drifting to a well deserved rest when you hear a shuffling sound and a pot fall over.
It is nothing
It seems someone still uses piss pots.
I don't want to know what it is. Look how my dogs are all nervous.
It is the tiger coming to eat the remains of the roast. The fire is still alight. I will hatch a plan!
You dance far too elegantly for the folk music. However your partner seems to enjoy the status of being with a great Wang. You lean in and tell her.
Thank you for the dance.
How would you like to live the life of royalty?
Your father looks passed out. Lead me discreetly to your reside..

Breathlessly she replies yes and you tell her to meet you by the gates in an hour. You wait. She arrives flustered in a cloak too long for her and you escort her to your tent. The pair of you spend the night exchanging vows and making love. You wake up, stretch and wake her up.
It's time for you to go home.
I will find you a husband.
I make you a royal concubine.
She tells you that she is planning on becoming a Shaman and appologizes, she doesn't want to be seen with a man now that the spirits and air are her master.
Rats.
We are quite in need of a Shaman in the palace.

You breathe on her neck and she pushes you off. You sit down with your men and she signals you to follow her, which you do from a distance. She leads you to a small dwelling with pigs walking in and out the property. You grimince as you go inside and pray you don't get ill. You remove your clothing reluctantly and make tender affections to the maiden on the bedding.
What a tigeress.
Your archers line up and they shoot a volley at the slowing down tiger. The tiger runs off into the forest but is retrieved an hour later by aides following its trail of blood.
The fur is mine.
Hang up the tiger and sell its fur for the victim's families'.
The archers shoot a volley and only one clefts the Tigers ear off. Most landind in the light thicket. It turns around and dashes.
Drats!
Fire a hopeful shot.
Set up camp. We'll try again.
You had little hope but it transpired that the heavens wanted that arrow to pierce the skull and land in the Tiger's cognation. Your men hail you as a master archer.
All pluck, no luck.
Thank heavens
Your archers line up and they shoot a volley at the tiger climbing up. The tiger scrambles despite the weight of arrows and makes it to the top before taking its final rest.
The fur is mine.
Hang up the tiger and promise to sell the proceeds of its fur to the victim's families'.
The archers shoot a volley and only one clefts the Tigers ear off. Most pierce lanterns and are fixed on the wall. The tiger reaches the top.
Drats!
Fire a hopeful shot.
You had little hope but it seems that the heavens wanted that arrow to pierce the behind of the tiger and unravel its organs. Your men hail you as a master archer.
All pluck, no luck.
Thank heavens
Your men attack the tiger and it kills one misfortunate. Fortunately the beast is overwhelmed by vengeful spears.
Holy animal of the mountains my arse.
Pay for a memorial.
Your men surge in a wave and the tiger in an pale blur slays one misfortunate who carried a Dan-knife. Your men scatter leaving you alone with the tiger.
Fight.
Run away. I will leave you spirit of the mountains
You drink deep from the only metal cup in the village. You feel enabled to do anything.
Climb a building.
Dance with anyone
Accuse the elder of being the tiger
List the glorious deeds of your ancestors

You climb a stocky hut, built out of logs and brown paste. Fortunately it doesn't have a paper screen so it is stable. You see your unfun subjects urging you to come down. After a near fall that you swear was improbable you reach the top. Safe at the top you scan the area and spot a tiger climbing the palisade.
Tiger!.
Observe the tiger from a birds eye view.
Your men scramble to their feet and thanks to your drunken ingenuinity, shouted at your top voice, flank the tiger and spear it to death against the wall.
I should lead like this more often..

The tiger tries to circle around you. You grab an abandoned spear and stab at the tiger. The tiger bleeds crimson drops and howls. After retreating so you can hear your heartbeats, the beast makes an ill decided lunge as you thrust with both hands. The spear goes cleanly through its neck. You run but the work is done.
You men are cowards!
Reap the praise.

The tiger tries to circle around you. You grab a spear and stab at the tiger. The tiger bleeds crimson drops and growls. After retreating so you can hear your heartbeats, the beast makes lunge pushing your spear sideways. You scream as it's claws slice your body.
Help!

The tiger starts licking the fat off itself. You charge and stab the tiger who lets out a roar tumbling into the fire. It briefly looks like a normal tiger as the flames cover it and in it's pain it leaps into a tent. Your men come out in a disorganized mess and shorten the tiger's suffering.
But the fur is ruined!
Burning bright.
You wait for a better opportunity but your dogs start barking. The tiger senses the soldiers waking and bounds off into the night sending fat splattering on some tents.
I'm going to not tell anybody!
You wait a few days arguing with your Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] and come to realize one of you aren't cut out for tiger hunting.
And it isn't me!
You dance with a rather grithy lady.
The best kind!.
It is morning and you wake up pressed against the wall by flesh. You must reach your clothes before the public finds out.
Help! Bodyguards!
Lift her off you.
You dance with an elderly lady.
The best kind!.
The elder introduces you to her daughter. Or what you believe based on her long hair.
The best kind!

You awake slowly to the sounds of birds chirping. You are rustled and you see the face of an emotional girl. "Get out of my parents bed before my father comes home and kills us all." She hisses. You look to your left and see an elderly woman unclothed.
Please direct me to the door!.

You awake slowly to the sounds of birds chirping. Light enters the room and you see a young woman asleep. You dress quietly and remember the tiger. On entering the next room you see her father tied up sleepless while her mother is asleep on their futon. Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] is by the door looking unamused.
Please direct me to the door!.
You loudly accuse the elder of the village of being the tiger. You explain the more perverse aspects of his masterplan to a dwindling audience.
Get the troops. Send him to jail!
It is a figure of speech. The tiger is in all of us.
I'm getting an early night.

After digging a well concealed hole nothing of note happens for the rest of the day. You are waken up at four in the morning. [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] says the tiger fell into your well disguised tiger trap this morning. She has been struggling to exit the earth.
Let me throw a spear to its miserable head.
Do you know the fable of the villager and tiger?

You observe the tiger make its way into the village and prowl into a henhouse. The commotion is silenced by the commemoration. You notice how satisifed it is as it makes its way up the ineffective palisade.
I will strive to be like the tiger!
You can be chicken and be eaten.
Suddenly on the perimeter. You hear a horn. The tiger is spot and riding closer you see its gastly form fearlessly approaching the village. What do you want to do?
Fill it with arrows.
Set the dogs on it. We can't run down this hill
After a week your soldiers return with the beast's fur. They claim they gave the meat to the starving villagers. The fur is luxurious and will make its impression on foreign dignitaries.
Great endevor men!
It was mine! Send these so called heroes to work in the mines.
column3: Quanzhen, the fulfilled virtue.
column4: Le Quanzhen, vertu remplies.

column2: Make a portrait of me killing the tiger. Frame it with jade.

Walking through your court one day you see [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] bent over a woodern table practicing caligraphy. You wait for a bow to your magnificance but in naught as [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] practices "Ka", the character for family, combining the pigs with the roof. Suddenly you are struck by the irony that your commoners who live with the pigs have no clue how to even form this symbol.
Let us make an experiment!
I love your style sonsengnim!
This had better result in something I can enjoy!

You gather some peasants, some levy soldiers and invite some city people to your estate. You present [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] with the heavy task of teaching them the heavenly radicals and to read. You will come back in a month to check on the progress.
I am a generous god.

It was a failure Wang-shi. You had almost forgotten about the experiment but on return [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] informed you everyone but one peasant had failed to learn the 200 common characters. This student had performed to [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]'s expectations who wants to bring him back to the court.
Let them do the enterance exam.
An untouchable?!?!
A steady hand and handsome? Of course!

It was a failure Wang-shi. You had almost forgotten about the experiment but on return [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] informed you everyone but one peasant had failed to learn the 200 common characters. This student had performed to [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]'s expectations who wants to bring her back to the court.
Let them do the enterance exam.
An untouchable?!?!
She's an untouchable. Only I get to touch her
You eagerly returned a day early to see a tale of two classes. The city students had learned roughly half of the characters
column3: the rice paddy fielders had learned barely forty on average. What [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] found striking was that many ignored the basic characters and focused on the radicals and complex characters. "I think it is because they are rebelious. What is your conclusion?"

column2: Proof bloodline purity makes for far smarter people.
We need to make an academy for the clever city folk.
The students didn't learn the characters they already had a word for. We should use an alphabet like the Japanese and seal all the foreign ideas to Han characters.
These foreign characters take too long to learn ...

You have recieved a suprise delegation from ________. Understanding you are determined to reform the language ______ suggests you only use your new script for grammatical principles (e.g. the, a, of).
Limit the new alphabet to grammar
Promise the alphabet will be only used for all native words.
I seem to have went too far. I will write an appology to the nobles.
You misunderstand me. I only intended to coin a handful of new chinese characters.
You have decided to reform the ancestrial language. After restless nights you have decided.
To select 30 Han characters and use them as letters.
To adapt Budhist scripts from the South Seas
To send a delegation into the steppies. Find out how they communicate
To create your own language
You choose 30 Han characters that your people have come to associate with certain sounds. You've drawn inspiration from past names of original dynasties.
This should work.
I should just give up.
You have summoned a Guru. For several weeks he teaches you the languages of india.
This is way out.
These innovations in writing could give us ways to express any consonant and vowel!
These new innovations could be coupled into syllable blocks to retain the structure of our Han vocabulary
This is the way out
You focus so much in learning the new alphabet that you notice you're in need of time to do other tasks. This experiment with regret should be closed.
At least I can now quote the Sutras in their purest form.
Delegate tasks I must persist!

After compromise and assistance from your Guru you fashion an alphabet that works. There is no need for memorising strange letter combinations like 'B-ae-k-j-e'. How it is said, it is written. For the first time you print the word for "I".
Announce to the people they have the right to write.

Consulting a growing staff you fashion an alphabet like you've never seen before. There is no need for memorising strange letter combinations like 'B-ae-k-j-e' as with the visible rules your people can write it in one or two letters if they wish. How it is said, it is written. For the first time you print the word for "I".
Announce to the people they could learn this alphabet in a week. If stupid.
Oops I left out "f" and "v" sounds!.
Your delegation has returned. They went into deepest Mongolia, met with Nestorians and even met a Greek on their return trip. They thank you for the bribes for saving their lives.
Those Mongolian scripts look grand. I'd rather be Khan than Han.
Do you think you could get the Christians to make us an alphabet?
What a waste of time.
Making an alphabet borders that fragile space between insanity and genius.
I'll create my own language.
Create a secret language.
The research began with a delegation south but quickly metamorphed into uncovering Christian missionary documents. These Nestorian letters seem really helpful to represent constanent sounds.
But would anyone use it.
You plan to create a pink bow and arrow for sweet ___________. Teaching life skills is important to get her more worldly.
Right through the heart!
No! No! Let's Reconsider.
You finish your archery set and hail her while you are visiting a temple. You offer her the bow and arrows and she asks you for lessons
Life lessons!
You are visiting a Buddhist monk for some advice when you meet __________. He offers you a bow and arrows. But you don't know what to do with it!
Ask him for lessons!
It's not my style!
You finish your archery set and set off for the shrine she visits. By chance you meet her and offer her the completed set. She blinks and says it is not to her style
She is feisty!
I tire of this!
You Give her first lesson with your arms around her half the time. You stress breath control and encourage her to change her targets.
One week to go!
Heart pounding _________ gives you your first archery lesson. You feel secure on his stable chest as he helps aim the bow. You managed to hit the scarecrow off.
One week to go!
You Give her first lesson with your arms around her half the time. She seems uncomfortable and doesn't hit any of the targets.
It could've went worse!
This bores me!
You meet ______ for a lesson. She looks ravishing and you step back to have a look when she lets loose a shot. Hitting the gardener in the arm by mistake.
Physican!
I'll save you!
You didn't mean to hit the gardener by mistake.
So embarassing.
You didn't mean to hit the gardener by mistake. Fortunately ___________ galently pulled the arrow and wrapped up the bleeding. He made the gardener swear to secretcy
I need to repay him somehow.
It is reported that ___________ is teaching your daughter how to draw a bow and arrow. On my own perogative I've collected extracts from their conversations.
I thought you're looking for the bulls eye, therefore I want to cut your arrows myself!
This sounds very practical. I've got to reward him..
Well if they are only going to draw ...
She is going on house arrest!.
Your guards drag in _________ who pleads innocent and only wanted to serve the country.
Your going to jail!
You will be of service in the army!
You meet _______ for her lesson. She hits the first three but is looking distracted. You make your move.
I have a house nearby [From.GetMilordMilady] it has better targets than here.
I'm affirmed. Now I can end this.
You show _______ your house and where your target is. She responds to your charms and hours later you have both given a few tries.
I have a house nearby [From.GetMilordMilady] it has better targets that this inside.
I'm affirmed. Now I can end this.

You follow ____________ to a house he definately rented. You go inside and see it is rather scarce apart from a floor-bed. He whispers some words and you embrace and you fall on the covers, somewhat earlier than you would've liked, your time together ends.
Oh how I arched!.
It is that time of year for Chuseok! Besides the feast I have to arrange the visit to my ancestors graves and catch up with family. Close brothers and sisters might come too. This means gifts!
Anticipation.

I hereby invite you to attend my celebration of the feast of Chuseok.

Your Liege,
[From.GetFullName]

column4: Die Tradition verlangt, dass Ihr zum Herbstfest Eurem Ehepartner ein Geschenk macht. Ihr solltet dies planen und etwas kaufen, bevor das Fest beginnt.

column4: Meine Frau ist überglücklich mit ihrem Geschenk.
column6: ¡Mi mujer está entusiasmada con el magnífico regalo!

column4: Meine Frau ist ungehalten, da sie nichts bekam.
column6: Mi mujer está enfadada porque no le traje nada.

column3: Ma maîtresse déborde de joie à la vue de son cadeau ! Mon épouse, en revanche...
column4: Meine Liebschaft ist überglücklich mit ihrem Geschenk! Meine Frau dagegen weniger…
column6: ¡Mi amante está entusiasmada con su regalo! Pero mi mujer no está muy contenta...

column3: Mon mari déborde de joie à la vue de son magnifique cadeau !
column4: Meine Ehemann ist überglücklich mit seinem Geschenk.

column2: The castle is decorated with flowers and colorful tapestries, carpets and ribbons. All the guests have arrived, there is a bustle of people all eager and full of festive spirit. It's time for the feast to begin!
column3: Le château est décoré de fleurs, de tentures, de tapis et de rubans de toutes les couleurs. Tous les invités sont là. Quelle belle foule de gens joyeux et remplis d'un esprit festif ! C'est l'heure, que le festin commence !
column4: Die Burg ist mit Blumen und bunten Tapeten, Teppichen und Schleifen geschmückt. Alle Gäste sind angekommen, ein wahres Gewühl von Menschen voller Freude und Festgeist. Es ist Zeit, die Feier beginnen zu lassen!
column6: El castillo está decorado con flores, coloridos tapetes, alfombras y lazos. Los invitados han llegado, hay bullicio de gente impaciente y con espíritu festivo. ¡Es hora de que comience el banquete!

column2: Welcome, all!
column3: Soyez tous les bienvenus !
column4: Seid Willkommen!
column6: ¡Bienvenidos todos!

column2: Cheosok is over, but it was all to the highest standard. Your guests make their way home and you gaze over the balcony, pleased at how things turned out.
column3: Le festin est terminé. C'était fabuleux ! Alors que les invités rentrent chez eux, vous vous asseyez, un sourire aux lèvres. Les choses se sont très bien déroulées.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und lächelt, zufrieden mit dem Ausgang.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te sonríes a ti mismo complacido de cómo han ido las cosas.

column2: I should do this again next year!
column3: Je ferai la même chose l'année prochaine !
column4: Ich sollte das nächstes Jahr erneut machen!
column6: ¡Debería repetirlo el año que viene!

column2: The Cheosok celebrations are over, but one incident stings. As the guests make their way home, you sit down and ponder what went wrong.
column3: Le festin est terminé, mais tout ne s'est pas déroulé comme prévu. Alors que les invités rentrent chez eux, vous passez en revue les incidents qui se sont produits.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch lief es nicht ganz wie gehofft. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und grübelt, was wohl schief ging.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero no ha salido como esperabas. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te preguntas qué ha salido mal.

column2: Maybe next time it will be better.
column3: La prochaine fois sera peut-être meilleure.
column4: Vielleicht wird es nächstes Jahr besser.
column6: Puede que la próxima vez vaya mejor.

column2: The Cheosok is over, but it was a fantastic feast. As you make your way home, you think that you'd probably come back next year again if invited.
column3: Le festin est terminé. C'était fabuleux ! Alors que vous reprenez le chemin de la maison, vous pensez qu'en cas d'invitation l'année prochaine, vous accepterez probablement.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, hofft Ihr, nächstes Jahr wiederkommen zu dürfen.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras regresas a casa, piensas que probablemente volverás el año que viene si te invitan.

column2: I had a great time!
column3: J'ai passé un excellent moment !
column4: Es war eine großartige Zeit!
column6: ¡Lo pasé muy bien!

column2: The Cheosok is over, but certain unfortunate events prevented you from enjoying it fully. As you make your way home, you ponder the ups and downs of life.
column3: Le festin est terminé mais des évènements malheureux vous ont empêché d'en profiter pleinement. Alors que vous rentrez chez vous, vous méditez sur les hauts et les bas de l'existence.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch einige unschöne Ereignisse verdarben die Stimmung. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, grübelt Ihr über die Höhen und Tiefen des Lebens.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero ciertos acontecimientos desafortunados han impedido que lo disfrutes plenamente. Mientras te diriges a casa reflexionas sobre los altibajos de la vida.

column2: Oh well.
column3: C'est la vie...
column4: Nun gut…
column6: En fin.

column2: A snake charmer from India is entertaining the guests at the feast. He plays a flute and sings in odd tones to various poisonous snakes that he has brought in a basket. The audience is held captivated by his skills as he seemingly controls the snakes with his voice and his music.
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. L'audience est captivée par son talent : il semble contrôler les serpents par le son de sa voix et par sa musique.
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Die Zuhörer sind ganz eingenommen von seinen Fähigkeiten, da er scheinbar die Schlangen allein mit seiner Stimme und Musik kontrolliert.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. La audiencia está atónita con sus habilidades pues parece controlar las serpientes con su voz y con su música.

column2: Fascinating!
column3: C'est fascinant !
column4: Faszinierend.
column6: ¡Fascinante!

column2: There is a silence among the revellers as the snake charmer works his magic with the snakes. But suddenly you hear a high shriek, and the snake charmer looks confused - it seems a large cobra has broken free and is slithering across the floor towards the guests!
column3: Les convives observent en silence le charmeur de serpents faire ses tours. Mais un cri perçant déchire l'air et le charmeur de serpents affiche une expression troublée. Il semble qu'un grand cobra ait pris quelques libertés, et le voilà qui traverse la salle en direction des invités !
column4: Die Feiernden schweigen, während der Schlangenbeschwörer seine Magie wirkt. Doch plötzlich hört Ihr einen lauten Schrei und der Beschwörer wirkt verwirrt - es scheint, dass eine große Kobra ausgebrochen ist und auf die Gäste zuschlängelt.
column6: Hay un silencio entre los asistentes cuando el encantador de serpientes realiza su magia con las serpientes. Pero de repente escuchas un alarido, el encantador de serpientes parece confuso - ¡una gran cobra está libre y rectando por el suelo hacia los invitados!

column2: Oh no!
column3: Oh non !
column4: Oh nein!
column6: ¡Oh, no!

column2: The escaped cobra disappears under the table. There are a few moments of silence, and then a shrill shriek. The cobra has slithered up into the lap of one of the guests, scaring the person half to death! The snake, then quickly disappears out through an open window.
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Après quelques moments de silence, un cri perçant retentit. Le cobra s'est glissé sur les genoux d'un invité, qui manque de mourir de peur ! Le serpent disparaît ensuite rapidement par une fenêtre ouverte.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein lauter Schrei. Die Kobra ist in den Schoß eines Gastes gekrochen und hat ihn zu Tode erschreckt. Dann verschwindet die Schlange schnell durch ein Fenster.
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un agudo chillido. ¡La cobra se ha arrastrado hasta el regazo de uno de los invitados, dándole un susto de muerte! La serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta.

column2: Back to India with you!
column3: Nous n'embaucherons plus ce charmeur de serpents.
column4: Dieser Schlangenbeschwörer wird nicht wieder auftreten!
column6: No volveremos a contratar al encantador de serpientes.

column2: A snake charmer is entertaining the guests at the feast. He plays a flute and sings in odd tones to various poisonous snakes that he has brought in a basket. Then, suddenly you feel something cold and slithery moving in your lap...
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. Soudain, vous sentez quelque chose de froid et de glissant ramper sur vos genoux...
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Plötzlich fühlt Ihr etwas kaltes und schlüpfriges in Eurem Schoß…
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. Entonces, de repente sientes algo frío reptando en tu regazo...

column2: Aaargh! A cobra!!
column3: Aaargh ! Un cobra !!
column4: Aaaaah! Eine Kobra!
column6: ¡Aaargh! ¡¡Una cobra!!

column2: The escaped cobra disappears under the table. There are a few moments of silence, and then a terrified scream. One of the guests is shaking in violent convulsions, with people nearby staring in shock as they realize the snake has bitten their neighbor. As the snake disappears out through an open window, the victim stops shaking and lies still, dead.
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Quelques instants de silence, puis un cri de terreur. Un des invités est en proie à de violentes convulsions. Les invités le fixent, figés de peur alors qu'ils comprennent que le serpent vient de mordre l'un des leurs. Alors que le serpent disparaît par une fenêtre ouverte, la victime cesse de trembler et s'effondre, sans vie.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein furchtbarer Schrei. Einer der Gäste zuckt unter Krämpfen, die Gäste daneben starren schockiert, als sie merken, dass die Schlange ihren Nachbar gebissen hat. Als die Schlange durch ein offenes Fenster entkommt, liegt das Opfer ruhig da... tot!
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un chillido de terror. Uno de los invitados se estremece en violentas convulsiones, con la gente petrificada mirando en cuanto se percatan de que la cobra ha mordido al vecino. Mientras la serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta, la víctima deja de agitarse y yace muerta.

column2: Woe!
column3: Malheur !
column4: Oh weh!
column6: ¡Lástima!

column2: The escaped cobra slithers across the floor. The guests at the table seem paralyzed, except for one person who quickly draws his sword and steps forward, chopping the animal in half with a swift cut.
column3: Le cobra en liberté glisse sur le sol. Les invités à la table sont comme paralysés, excepté l'un d'eux qui tire rapidement son épée et s'avance, tranchant l'animal en deux d'un coup vif.
column4: Die entkommene Schlange kriecht über den Boden. Die Gäste am Tisch wirken paralysiert, außer einer Person, welche schnell ihr Schwert zieht und mit gezieltem Schlag das Tier erschlägt.
column6: La cobra fugada se arrastra por el suelo. Los invitados de la mesa parecen paralizados, excepto una persona que rápidamente saca su espada y da un paso al frente, cortando al animal a la mitad rápidamente.

column2: Well done!
column3: Bravo !
column4: Gut gemacht!
column6: ¡Bien hecho!

column2: A snake charmer is entertaining the guests at the feast, until suddenly a cobra escapes! You quickly draw your sword and step forward, chopping the animal in half with a swift cut.
column3: Un charmeur de serpents donne un spectacle pour les invités au festin quand soudain un cobra s'échappe ! Vous tirez rapidement votre épée et vous avancez vers la bête, que vous tranchez en deux d'un coup vif.
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste des Festes, als plötzlich eine Kobra entkommt. Schnell zieht Ihr Euer Schwert, tretet vor und hackt mit flinkem Schlag das Tier in zwei Teile.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete, ¡hasta que la cobra escapa! Rápidamente, sacas tu espada y das un paso al frente, contando al animal a la mitad.

column2: Don't try this at home, folks.
column3: N'essayez pas ça à la maison !
column4: Macht das ja nicht zu Hause nach!
column6: No intentéis esto en casa, chicos.

column2: The Shaman
column3: Le Shaman
column4: Der Magier
column6: El Shaman

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a shaman from the Azur enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that the coming show will astound even the most cyncial spectator. He proceeds to put a small boy into a basket on the floor, wherafter he swiftly chops the basket into little pieces with a sword. When he removes the shreds of the basket, there is no sign of the boy, no blood, nothing...
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il explique que le spectacle qui va suivre sera à même d'étonner même le plus cynique des spectateurs. Il place ensuite un petit garçon dans un panier puis, de son épée, taillade le panier et le met en pièces. Lorsqu'il soulève ce qui reste du panier, le petit garçon a disparu, pas une goutte de sang, rien du tout...
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass sein Auftritt selbst den zynischsten Beobachter verblüffen wird. Daraufhin steckt er einen kleinen Jungen in einen großen, auf dem Boden stehenden Korb - und beginnt, den Korb mit einem Schwert in Stücke zu hauen. Als er die Fetzen des Korbs schließlich entfernt, ist da kein Zeichen des Jungen, kein Blut, nichts...
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, explica que la próxima actuación dejará estupefacto hasta al más cínico. Comienza a introducir a un pequeño crío en una cesta en el suelo, entonces corta el cesto en trocitos con una espada. Retira los jirones de la cesta y no hay rastro del crío, ni sangre, nada...

column2: Amazing!
column3: Épatant !
column4: Wunderbar!
column6: ¡Increíble!

column2: Guards - arrest that man!
column3: Gardes ! Arrêtez cet homme !
column4: Wachen - nehmt ihn fest!
column6: ¡Guardias, arrestad a ese hombre!

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a Buddist wanderer enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he places three cups before you on the table. He places a ball under one cup, and then tells you to observe closely and tell you where the ball is after he finishes moving the cups. He then shifts the cups around with lightning speed, all the while prattling on and telling you to pay attention. He then asks you to pick a cup.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il place trois coupes devant vous sur la table. Il place ensuite une balle sous l'une des coupes et vous demande de prêter la plus grande attention : vous allez devoir deviner où se trouve la balle. Il déplace ensuite les coupes à la vitesse tout en déblatérant et en vous demandant de vous concentrer. Il vous demande alors de choisir une coupe.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten stellt er drei Becher auf den Tisch vor Euch. Er platziert eine kleine Kugel unter einem davon und fordert Euch auf, gut zu beobachten und ihm zu verraten, wo die Kugel nach dem Bewegen der Becher ist. Dann verschiebt er die Becher blitzartig hin und her, während er weiter plappert und aufzupassen ermahnt. Schließlich sollt Ihr einen Becher wählen.
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, coloca tres copas en la mesa. Coloca una bola bajo una copa, y te dice que observes detenidamente y digas dónde está la bola cuando termine de mover las copas. Entonces mueve las copas a la velocidad del rayo, todo mientras parlotea y te dice que prestes atención. Entonces te pide que elijas una copa.

column2: Left.
column3: Celle de gauche.
column4: Links.
column6: Izquierda.

column2: Middle.
column3: Celle du milieu.
column4: Mitte.
column6: Centro.

column2: Right.
column3: Celle de droite.
column4: Rechts.
column6: Derecha.

column2: The magician looks at you with a knowing and superior smile as he reveals the ball. It seems you chose the wrong cup.
column3: Le magicien vous toise de son air supérieur et dévoile l'emplacement de la balle. Visiblement, vous n'avez pas choisi la bonne coupe.
column4: Der Magier schaut Euch mit wissendem Lächeln an und enthüllt die Kugel. Scheinbar habt Ihr den falschen Becher gewählt.
column6: El mago te mira con una sonrisa de superioridad y revela la bola. Parece que elegiste la que no era.

column2: Oh snap.
column3: Zut !
column4: Oh verdammt.
column6: Lo tengo.

column2: I think you are cheating!
column3: Je pense que vous avez triché !
column4: Ich glaube, Ihr betrügt!
column6: ¡Creo que haces trampas!

column2: I saw you cheating, you trickster!
column3: Je vous ai vu tricher, sale escroc !
column4: Ich sah Euch mogeln, Ihr Gauner!
column6: ¡Te he visto hacer trampas, embaucador!

column2: Rope Trick

There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a mage enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that you are about to see something amazing. He takes out a rope and starts playing a flute. The rope starts dancing by itself and rises up towards the ceiling. The magician beckons, and a small boy appears and starts climbing the rope. The audience gasps. After a minute, the boy climbs down, the magician stops playing and the rope falls down again.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il vous explique que vous allez être le témoin d'une chose extraordinaire. Il sort une corde et commence à jouer de la flûte. La corde se met à danser toute seule et monte ainsi jusqu'au plafond. Le magicien fait un signe de la tête. Un petit garçon s'avance et commence à monter le long de la corde. Les spectateurs retiennent leur souffle. Après une minute, l'enfant redescend. Le magicien arrête de jouer et la corde tombe au sol.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass Ihr gleich etwas Wunderbares sehen werdet. Er holt ein Seil hervor und beginnt auf der Flöte zu spielen. Das Seil beginnt zu tanzen und erhebt sich zur Decke. Der Magier klascht, ein kleiner Junge erscheint und erklettert das Seil. Das Publikum keucht. Nach einer Minute steigt der Junge wieder herab, der Magier beendet sein Flötenspiel und das Seil fällt wieder herab.
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, explica que vais a ver algo increíble. Coge una cuerda y comienza a tocar una flauta. La cuerda comienza a danzar hacia el techo. El mago hace un gesto y un pequeño chico aparece y comienza a trepar por la cuerda. El público contiene un grito. Tras un minuto, el chico desciende de la cuerda, el mago deja de tocar la flauta y la cuerda cae.

column2: Amazing
column3: Bien travail!
column4: Hah! Ich konnte den versteckten Draht sehen.
column6: ¡Ja! He podido ver un cable oculto.

column2: Hah! I could see the hidden wire.
column3: Joli ! Vous aviez un fil invisible, je l'ai vu !
column4: Hah! Ich konnte den versteckten Draht sehen.
column6: ¡Ja! He podido ver un cable oculto.

column2: You are sitting at the table during the feast, enjoying the food and drink. Suddenly, you hear wild tweeting and singing. A swarm of magpies have entered through an open window, and they quickly spread in the hall, causing chaos! They get in people's hair and clothes, steal food, spill wine, drink wine and defecate on the tables. The feast hall is in uproar.
column3: Vous voilà à table pendant le festin, à savourer repas et boissons. Soudain, vous entendez une discussion animée entrecoupée de cris. Un groupe de petits singes est entré par une fenêtre ouverte et se répand dans la salle, entraînant le chaos ! Ils tirent les gens par les cheveux et les vêtements, volent de la nourriture, renversent les coupes, boivent le vin et défèquent sur les tables.
column4: Ihr sitzt am Tisch und genießt das Fest, vor allem Speis und Trank. Plötzlich hört Ihr lautes Geschwätz und Schreie. Eine Gruppe kleiner Affen ist durch ein offenes Fenster eingedrungen, verteilt sich in der Halle und verursacht Chaos! Sie ziehen an Haaren und Kleidern, stehlen Essen, verschütten und trinken Wein oder entleeren ihren Darm auf den Tischen. Die Festhalle ist in Aufruhr!
column6: Te sientas en una mesa durante el banquete, disfrutando de la comida y la bebida. De repente, escuchas un parloteo salvaje y gritos. Un pequeño grupo de monos ha entrado por una ventana abierta, y rápidamente se distribuyen por el salón, ¡causando el caos! Tiran a la gente del pelo y las ropas, roban la comida, tiran el vino o se lo beben y defecan en las mesas. El salón de banquetes es un clamor.

column2: Oh my!
column3: Grands dieux !
column4: Oh mein…
column6: ¡Oh, madre!

column2: Hand me my bow!
